summary: This bill, the Patawomeck Indian Tribe of Virginia Federal Recognition Act, seeks to extend federal recognition to the Patawomeck Indian Tribe of Virginia. It outlines findings about the tribe's history, defines key terms, and grants the tribe eligibility for federal services and benefits. It also specifies the tribe's service area, addresses membership and governing documents, and allows the Secretary of the Interior to take land into trust for the tribe. Notably, the bill prohibits gaming activities and clarifies that it does not affect any existing rights of the tribe.
